title: Sinitta to miss out on The X Factor judges’ houses – as Louis Tomlinson will replace her
content:
It’s all change at The X Factor judges’ houses this year – as for the first time since anyone can remember you won’t be seeing Sinitta there. 

Yes, the Toy Boy singer – who has traditionally always joined Simon Cowell to help him pick his acts for the live shows – is reportedly being replaced by One Direction’s Louis Tomlinson at that all-important stage in the series. 

Which means you won’t be seeing sights like this any more: 

Or this: 

OK, so we’re disappointed. But don’t worry folks, it doesn’t mean that we won’t be seeing her on the show again in the future. 

‘Simon and Sinitta haven’t fallen out,’ a source told the Radio Times. ‘They’re just trying something different this year.’ 

‘As part of it’s live, it’s a case of timings,’ the insider added. ‘We’re only going to see the contestants’ performances on location, as those decisions are being made back at Wembley. 

‘So there’s no time for all of those different critiques.’ 

Sinitta has been a regular fixture at judges’ houses in the past, even going so far as to join Louis Walsh when Simon Cowell was not a judge. 

This year will see Simon take his Overs hopefuls to France, while Rita Ora and the girls will head for Los Angeles. 

Meanwhile Cheryl Fernandez-Versini is taking the groups to Rome – while Nick Grimshaw’s boys category may have to content themselves with a trip to Greater Manchester, in order to fit around his radio commitments.
